intro: Alyxia squamulosa, commonly known as the silky alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in rocky, arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by orange or red berries. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Alyxia squamulosa is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
